Its narrative themes are familar, but the score is impeccable and the animation is beautiful. Ambitious and exciting to a fault, How to Train Your Dragon is the best Dreamworks film in years.

name: kubo_and_the_two_strings_2016
review: My #1 favorite movie of 2016. Kubo is everything I could want in a movie. I have no flaws with this movie. It's beautifully animated, voice acted, and such a cool story. I really wish people would support this more than they did. Laika studios has put out their best film here.

name: kubo_and_the_two_strings_2016
review: I have no idea why people pretend to enjoy "Kubo and the Two Strings" so much. This is possibly the worst movie I have seen in my entire life. The movie doesn't make sense- nothing is explained properly, and the characters are annoying. Also, there are three strings, not two.

name: kubo_and_the_two_strings_2016
review: The first animated film in history to get an Oscar nomination for Best VFX, is only one of many reasons why this was my #2 overall pick of 2016. If this movie doesn't burst your fleshy water pipes, I'm afraid you might have no soul.

name: 1010678-invasion_of_the_body_snatchers

review: Slow moving, strange and, yes, very pretentous film but i love it. It's mysterious and beautifully shot.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Last Year at Marienbad is one of the most poetic, hypnotic and beautiful films ever made.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: To say this film is highly influential is obvious. What I admire about this visual work of serious originality is that Resnais disregards any notions of narrative that Hollywood films are chained to. I couldn't imagine being dead and not having seen this film, it's that good.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: May be The perfect film. 10/10

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: One of the most difficult films to find on dvd, this masterpiece from acclaimed french director alain resnai is a cinematic,unforgetable,oustanding and brilliant film that defined a new genre and the non-linear stories. The french new wave as never seen before.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: This is a classic! A brilliant film about the power of imagination and the wonders and horrors it can bring. I don't know this for sure but Chris Nolan might have taken some notes for Inception from this movie. But all in all there really is no other movie like this movie.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: An experiment in form and narrative modes by two experimentalists of their own medium: Alain Resnais and Alain Robbe-Grillet. The result is difficult to watch if you want meaning, but endlessly fascinating if you enjoy experimental art.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: What a load of pretentious bourgeois boredom.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: marienbad, mindgame and masterpiece all three begin with m.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Elegantly, crazily enigmatic.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: I was worried, going in, that it wouldn't be as entertaining as it turned out to be. The film knows what it's doing, and how to grab your attention. How the whole thing works as well as it does, is beyond me, though.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: ... do you, Mr. Jones?

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Brilliant if you want to improve your French as the same lines are repeated over and over. I know it's French New Wave but after awhile I played it at 2x forward and it was still too slow.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Hypnotic, enigmatic, and maddening in the most beautiful way.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Last Year at Marienbad may be the most important film you ever see. It dares you to throw away any preconceived notions of what a film is and simply sit back and experience something. Please, PLEASE do not take my word for this. Stop reading and seek this film out.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: This film makes 8 1/2 looks like a teen! I thought Fellini's already twisted, but this... this is extreme!

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: I simply can't explain.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Sublime. Cinema at its best. Alain Renais' indisputable masterpiece

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: It makes sense if you don't think of it as a normal movie. It's like a puzzle, a maze, a game. Everything eventually fits into place.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Pretentious rubbish. Pseudointellectual claptrap. This film has been conning people for nigh on fifty years - the only thing to be said in its favor is that the con is so elaborate that even today people fall into its trap

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Resnais creates a vaguely unsettling mood by means of stylish composition, long, smooth tracking shots along the hotel's deserted corridors, and strangely detached performances. Obscure, oneiric, it's either some sort of masterpiece or meaningless twaddle

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Before ANNIE HALL, before WHEN HARRY MET SALLY, before MICKEY BLUE EYES there was LAST YEAR AT MARIENBAD. It has nothing to do with those films, but it was made before them.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Did I understand it? Hell no! But do I enjoy bandying about random theories about what it all means? Oh yes. The movie's editing and misÃ©-en-scene is so hypnotizing that I can't believe I haven't analyzed yet in any film class. Fail, film school. It's a movie that I can't wait to witness again.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Stagnant black water in a champagne bottle.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Utterly confusing, I have no idea what the thing means or is even about, but emotionally it was so overwhelming that I could help but be taken by it.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: I know that this is a classic of modern cinema but I HATED it!!!

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Great cinematography! Really need to hold your nerves to get through this one.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: I hate this movie for more reasons than I care to mention.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Possibly the most visually stunning film I've ever seen...

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: This was like watching a long pretentious cologne commercial. Although the cinematography is beautiful, the film as a whole, in my opinion, is a complete waste of one's time.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: An all time classic of non-linear story telling.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Probably one of the top ten best films ever made, and definitely the greatest cinematic feat to come out of France.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: I hated every single minute of this movie, but great cinematography.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: The exquisitely photographed "Last Year at Marienbad" is a technical and narrative marvel that casts a dreamlike spell.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Resnais created a matchless maze for the mind to try. The look and atmosphere are impeccable.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: It's less an existential mystery and more an avant-garde horror flick. Also, it came out a year before Exterminating Angel, and it makes Luis BuÃ±uel look like a hack.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: holy shit. this might be the most beautiful film i have ever seen. it's look, feel, sound and pace were like heaven.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: A movie that makes you think over life and relationships... The present, the past and the future mixes and you're totally lost in a movie where nothing seems to be a fact... Yet a great film which makes you feel that it tries to say sth about the essence of living to the person who watches it.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: absolutely inspiring film.truly a cinematic poetry

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: sarÃ  anche un esercizio di stile, ma che stile! un film dove il montaggio porta avanti una narrazione quasi onirica. una storia semplice dai tratti psicologici ultracomplessi, dove il dettaglio, la consequenzialitÃ , le spiegazioni non contano. film da rivedere e da riscoprire piÃ¹ volte.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: A complex, extremely challenging meditation on the nature of film, reality, memory, perception, life and the afterlife. Not to sound stuck up, but this one requires much patience and some sophistication with the medium to appreciate, but it's well worth the leg work to get to this point.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: This film was rather bland. I also found the music overpowering in rather uneventful scenes. However, I can respect it's iconic status within film.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: An entrancing and intriguing film, with beautiful cinematography. Not an easy or relaxing film to watch, but a masterpiece.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: This film is like a hint of scent that lingers forever. There hasn't been any others like it. Elegantly romantic and melancholy, yet not self-indulgent.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Plus qu'un film, une experience. Une enigme qui ne se laisse pas facilement dechiffrer. Une piece d'anthologie du cinema. La plupart des gens passeront a cote et c'est bien dommage.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: This is the best, maybe the only, transposition of the aesthetics of di Chirico and Magritte into cinematic language.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: I'm going to say this is like the greatest movie ever because I don't want anyone to think less of me.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Una obra maestra, que ademas de innovar no cae en el pseudo intelectualismo.! como algunas obras de la nueva ola.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Interesting to compare with other Resnais' movies which dealt with the same subject, memory.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: An intriguing and extraordinarily beautiful film. I don't think I've ever seen any movie toy with time and space so freely. It speaks volumes about the nature, the texture, of romance in all its stages. I also got a bit of a Jean Renoir vibe from it, a mockery of bourgeois customs and attitudes.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Maybe I would think differently of this movie after being in film for two years, but at the time I watched I remember the feeling of wanting to stick forks in my eyes!

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: a beautiful, misterious, mesmerizing puzzle. Let the interpretations begin about this masterpiece.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: I fucking love Resnais.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: SÃ³lo un poco intelectual, pero increÃ­ble!

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: I saw this again recently. On a proper theatre, without subtitles. No doubt it's a master piece. I forgot the time passing by.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Pretenciosa y aburrida hasta donde no se puede más.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: I think this and Orson Welles' "The Trial" are at least indirectly responsible for basically every movie I have ever really loved. Amazing, gorgeous, creepy, and truly dreamlike.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: I forgot how FUCKING AMAZING this film is. Maybe it's super-pretentious, but can you really call it pretentious when it's pulled off this fabulously? I could watch it forever.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: The film resists plot in a way that allows the viewers imagination to run wild in reverie. Sensual, mysterious, breath-takingly beautiful.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: boring for lots people, amazing for me

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: a world freed from the constraints of convention, time and space. It is an exploration of the netherworld where time has no meaning and memory is an illusion. It might be the afterlife, or it might be a dream.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: THE movie on memory. Alain Renais masterpiece, time and place fragment implicating the viewer in figuring the past from the present from the future. One of the very best, jaw dropping beauty emanates from every frame and cut

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Amazing. I have never seen a movie like this. There are many attempts to imitate it, but nothing that comes close.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Je me suis rarement autant ennuyee au cinema, je n'ai rien compris et je deteste A. Robbe-Grillet encore plus qu'avant.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: I love Resnais' other films but this was painful..

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: I first saw this on a pretty awful VHS copy about 12 years ago and wasn't able to get why it was so well liked. What a difference a big screen and a new print makes!

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Such a great movie. GodDAMN.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Perfectly deep, filled with symbolisms and a wide arrange of mindblowing reflections about memory and interpretation of reality.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: This film is like a strange mathematical formula that produces proof of nothing but remains icily beautiful in its abstract perfection.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: This film begins in the most confusing state any film has, and it ends in this same state. The story an affair, of love, of betrayal, all leading to a final question mark on the query of reality. A film that changed time, space, and warps what you may or may not believe about what a story must be.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Haunting. To be sure, one of the strangest films ever made. It could mean anything or nothing...maybe both.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: So beautiful to watch! I'm so glad I saw it...I almost didn't. The clothes were GORGEOUS as was the Hotel. Me loved it!

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: sexy...sexy. The closest I have ever been to a waking dream.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: J'ai beau etudie en cinema et comprendre tout le processus creatif derriere le film... quand c'est plate, c'est plate...

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Superb and irresistable each time you see it! Resnais needs to be given more attention this his fellow new wave compatriots.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: A truely magical trippy poem of an art movie.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Perfectly scripted by Alain Robbe-Grillet (who won't be coming down to breakfast, as my uncle would say).

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Art Direction - 8/10 Acting - 2/10 Music - 0/10 Plot - 0/10 i.e. it looks pretty, but it's pretentious rubbish!

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: This is one of the great mysteries in cinema. Resnais created a masterpiece that will only get better with each viewing.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: I have always fantasized about watching a film that flows like a poem, by its visuals, its sounds, its plot (yes I said it) and most importantly its dialog. Very shockingly i have found such a film... Think of it as a poetic surrealistic dream.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Supreme masterpiece. Alain Resnais films reality.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961

review: words can hardly describe, just simply a must see masterpiece

review: I don't think we need to understand everything, in cinema or in life. I like it as I like the words I secretly tell myself in dreams...

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961

review: My favorite pretentious Euro-art film. Oblique and enigmatic.

review: fuck. this. movie!!!! it's so seriously fucked in such a unfair mindfuck sort of way, that it's beautiful and evil and required viewing for someone who wants to make or study movies. hopefully i over used fuck.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: ouf!!! intense, mais dÃ©licat..

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: to quote a g.marx:  You have the lover, the loved one and the authority figure. The movie proposes that the lovers had an affair, that they didn't, that they met before, that they didn't, that the authority figure knew it, that he didn't, that he killed her, that he didn't. Any questions?

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: It's at same time the last realistic movie and the first crystaline movie. A masterpiece of time-image.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: What makes 'Marienbad' so brilliant is that within this airless and artificial construct of endless repetition and manicured lawns, the effect isn't claustrophobic, but expansive. It's a meditation on memory and time, an existential puzzle, a post-modern sci-fi set in a holographic universe

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: I also fell in love last year at mariembad

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: A great mixture between dreams , fantacies and reality ..so u can see it in many different ways the same way u see the statue in the movie..

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Excellent surreal film. Love it.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: One of the great mind-twisting cinema experiences; are they flashbacks, memories, fantasies? Also, a lot more fun than people give it credit for. Look sharp for the cardboard cutout of Alfred Hitchcock!

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Mystical, splendid, delicate, poetical, simply classic. My favourite piece of Alain Resnais'.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Great Classic, not only a part of Resnais' oeuvre, but great fiction by the wonderful Alain Robbes-Grillet.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: A unique viewing experience, a perfect mystery which is never resolved. The setting and the cinematography perfectly reflect the themes of the script. A truly inspiring experience.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Read Emma Wilson's book about Alain Resnais, her chapter on this movie pulls together a lot of great analyses into one sweeping yet incisive view. I need to see it again now.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: A dazzling, enigmatic film - more like a visual symphony with its motifs and themes.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Five stars times ten. Also, if you watch the dvd, make sure you watch the intriguing marienbad-documentary.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: David Lynch eat yo' heart out. One of the most beautiful, puzzling films I've seen.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Abstruse. To say the least. Fantastic movie.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: now THIS is how you make an art film.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Finally got to see this after almost 14 yrs since I first read about it. It was everything I expected, and more! Truly haunting and keeps you guessing. People might say it's pretentious, but I loved the visual style!

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Such poetry! Like a musical score with sweeping theatrical shots, narrative repetitions & porcelain emotion-less faces.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: An unsolvable puzzle piece, this film may suffer from a deliberate, funereally slow pacing but more than makes up for it as a perfect work of High Modernism. It may bore the average audience, but it is highly recommended for the adventurous viewer.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: A simple, realistic story well presented

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: There are enough memorable, strikingly composed shots here for a good short film, but as a 90-minute-plus whole, it's the most agonizingly dull, unbelievably pretentious thing I've ever seen. Kael and the Medveds were right about this one.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961
review: Kjem an på humoeret, men denne kan vera ein kalkun, men og eit genialt kunstverk - men tru ikkje at du forstaar ...

review: Sexy and beautiful. Only Wong Kar-Wai can destabalize like this.

review: Enigmatic and demanding. Great the 3rd time. From 1962, best film year ever.

review: One of my favourite movies of all time. Dunno who put 2003 on it - it should be 1961.

review: aesthetic perfection

review: Like fabric. Indescribable.

name: lannee_derniere_a_marienbad_1961

Race across the desert being chased by bad guys only to find out where you were going isn't there, so go back from whence you came, kill all the rest of the bad guys, world peace restored. Two hours of my life I won't get back. This won Oscars for technical merit? I guess. #yawn

name: nosferatu
review: One of the best films of all time, it was a master piece shot in the style of German Expressionism. It utilised several techniques such as stop motion and foreshadowing. The story itself was a loose adaptation of Dracula though the creepy effect is still haunting even till today.

name: nosferatu
review: It is incontestably a historical piece of cinema, the birth of the vampire in popular culture as well as a great example of the German Expressionist moviment. A classic of the classics. 5/5 stars

name: nosferatu
review: This timeless horror classic is scary, but enjoyable to watch and is better than lots of horror films today. I could watch this a thousand times and it would still be creepy. This masterpiece has great music, great actors, and it lives up to its eeriness to this day.

name: nosferatu
review: Shrek's terrifying disposition as Nosferatu adds a whole new layer of horror. Murnau is in top form as always. The visuals and tight structure are to be revered and are frequently mimicked in modern horror with good reason.

name: nosferatu
review: Amazingly eerie and frighteningly alive despite the limitations of this silent era of filming. I am a lover of all things horror, and this movie fit the bill very well. The creepiness of Nosferatu still works even in 2014, where there is a high standard for horror.

name: nosferatu

name: nosferatu
review: Wonderfully acted and hauntingly shot, Murnau's horror epic still retains its power nearly 100 years (!) after it was made. Hilariously, considering the circumstances under which it was made, it also might be the best film adaption of "Dracula" to date.

name: nosferatu
review: It's a classic, what's not to love.

name: nosferatu
review: Schreck plays the eponymous vampire with an almost savage simplicity, and teamed with Murnau's striking and frightful visual storytelling created some of cinema's most lasting and haunting imagery. While not out and out terrifying, Nosferatu is eerily spooky and chilling.

name: nosferatu
review: One of the greatest horror films of all time.

The shots are more iconic, the score is outstanding, the Monster learns to speak and the film mixes creepiness, pathos and still-impressive special effects into one incredible film. A visual masterpiece, regardless of genre.

name: bride_of_frankenstein
review: One of the great horror films, is also a biting satire of love and acceptance. Lonely guy wants to meet a nice girl, he gets two doctors to create her and she rejects him. But that's how it goes in life. The ugly guy will always be rejected by the girl for the good looking doctor.

name: bride_of_frankenstein

name: seventh_seal

The film contains some of the most iconic shots in all of Cinema and the Criterion collection release looks great.

name: jodorowskys_dune
review: Jodorowsky's Dune is a fascinating examination of a maverick director's attempt to make his passion project - an adaptation of the classic sci-fi book Dune. Probably the best film I've seen.
Stylish, sublime, subtle.
Fellini' surreal and unconventional masterpiece that gets into the heart and mind of a filmmaker.
8 1/2 shows the greatness of Fellini's cinematic technique in a creative, smart and beautiful production.

It's a seminal work of interwoven dreams that is so seamlessly put together the audience often has trouble deciding what is relatity, and what is not. For most movies, this would prove disastrous. But for 8 1/2, it's a factor that is critical in the film's success.
8 1/2 is a soaring achievement of filmmaking, possibly the greatest of Federico Fellini's career, and simply one of the most creative, challenging, and comical movies ever made.
La vida es una fiesta, vivámosla con Fellini... ¡Qué pinche CHULADA de pelicula!

This is simply genius film making - thematically and artistically. Just when I want to critique it on something, it addresses my critique with sharp self-awareness. It's spectacular to behold with memorable scenes and superb shot making. A Big (capital "B") film in all senses of the word.
8 1/2 is one of the best movies about film making, within a fantasy that clashes with reality.Short answer = It's a masterpiece
The best italian movie. The best Fellini's dream.

The thing I loved about this film when I first watched it was that almost everything in 8 1/2 contradicts the traditional seamless story line of the conventional Hollywood film. For film makers, this is the film to watch.
The most pretentious waste of celluloid I've ever wasted my time on.
A perfect film, that touches the reality in such a personal, but oniric way, giving you the strength to live naturally, not for the others, but to live for you, with the others.
Fellini's flaud character gets more depth with every scene. Difficult movie to process yet wonderful and fulfilling.
A classic that indubitably lives up to the name. Staggeringly beautiful, humorous, rich, spiritual and humane.
Asa nisi masa, so save time. Three different languages?

we are smothered by words, images and sounds that have no right to exist, that come from the void and return to the void. Of any artist truly deserving of the name we should ask nothing but this act of faith: to learn silence.
One of most beautifully shot movies ever! Fellini at his best. Insightful but slow at times
Wonderful performances, gorgeous cinematography, beautiful musical score, immaculately directed and an intriguing non-linear storyline. My favourite film of all time. What more can I say.
Excellent in every way. Simultaneously wildly entertaining and funny while also deeply moving and touching, it's also a delight to watch and listen to.
The only movie to truly show what it is like to make a movie. No one does this stuff like Fellini.
A surreal masterpiece
Another wonderful film by Fellini! This portrayal of a film making a film is comical, sad, and just a sight to behold.
Is it the best film ever made ? I think it might well be.
Fellini on Fellini, on Film, on Life, on everything.

A splendid film by Federico Fellini, a story about a film director, drained out of ideas and without the motivation to deal with his new film. Reality and fantasy mixed during the story exploring the main character's subconscious.
A quirky avant garde dramedy about the creative struggle and art's relation to life.
back to brilliant classics....
Can't believe it took me so long to see something by Fellini. What a trip this movie is.
As an inspiring film director, this film strikes a chord. Deeply personal, insightful, and intriguing, Fellini's "8 1/2" is the most important film of his esteemed career.

"We're smothered by images, words and sounds that have no right to exist, coming from and bound, for. Of any artist truly worth the name we should ask nothing except this act of faith: to learn silence"
A daydream, a magic, a journey into human hopes and dreams. The living and the dead... we should love them as they are, until the final, unforgettable march. The greatest movie of all times!
A flat out masterwork, and a stunning precursor not only to Fellini's future but the future of cinema. Metafiction at it's finest.
Fellini's masterpiece is incredibly influential, masterfully made and a perfect statement for stifled creativity.
